messages.body:
The villains:
, of Virgin (sometimes Virgins) Atlantic
, of Tanfield Chambers (not! see below)


The hero:
 - 7 feet of baiter
messages.raw:
The villains:
Dr. Bernadette Fallon, of Virgin (sometimes Virgins) Atlantic
Barrister Mrs X, of Tanfield Chambers (not! see below)

The hero:
Lou Al Sindor - 7 feet of baiter

Lengthy scam-o-note:
Tanfield Chambers is a real law firm, in London.
They have, of course, nothing to do with this scam, see their warning about it.
Barrister Mrs. X is a real barrister with that firm.

Scamorama prefers to X out names of real people apparently being impersonated, unless they are 'public' figures.
[Example: you send your scanned passport to a scammer, who uses it to scam someone else - which the scammer tries here, btw.]
Barrister Mrs. X is neither famous nor anonymous, but it seemed prudent to change her name, as she is probably sick of this.

Now read this hilarious scambait!

messages.body:
******************************************************


   -  Networks. Communications Department


ID/FORM:ISO900018


RE: 070 PN2 Number Order Form
*In line with the commemorating event marking our 25th anniversary we
rolled out over 16,000.000.00 (Sixteen Million Great Britain Pounds) for
our 25th Anniversary Draws. You have a certified cheque of £120,000 GBP
 presently ready for delivery, Please kindly choose with any of the courier
service system that suit your delivery mode to your designated location and
note that, the courier service system charges cannot be deducted from the
original amount due to the fact that, it was registered under high
insurance policy and cheque must be delivered to you in complete amount.*
*
messages.raw:
Dr. Bernadette Fallon

Unexpected financial windfall, with courier information thoughtfully provided!

DATE: 19/12/2011

******************************************************

- Networks. Communications Department

ID/FORM:ISO900018

RE: 070 PN2 Number Order Form
*In line with the commemorating event marking our 25th anniversary we rolled out over 16,000.000.00 (Sixteen Million Great Britain Pounds) for our 25th Anniversary Draws. You have a certified cheque of £120,000 GBP presently ready for delivery, Please kindly choose with any of the courier service system that suit your delivery mode to your designated location and note that, the courier service system charges cannot be deducted from the original amount due to the fact that, it was registered under high insurance policy and cheque must be delivered to you in complete amount.*
*

messages.body:
12/21/11


This is all very sudden and surprising. 
I won some money, but you want me
to send you money to get it?


Lou
messages.raw:
Lou Sindor

12/21/11

This is all very sudden and surprising.
I won some money, but you want me to send you money to get it?

Lou

I won some money...: This is such a clear and concise expression of the '419' advance fee fraud scam (subgenre: 'unexpected financial windfall'). Post Lou's words on the refrigerator of any friend or relative vulnerable to this scam.

messages.body:
UK VIRGINS ATLANTIC net-communicationcenter@hotmail.com


12/22/11


Good Day,


I received your email and I advise you make contact with Barrister Mrs X via the email address below (
(scammer name)@hotmail.co.uk) she will guide you on the step to take in
regards to the necessary courier charges.


Once again congratulation.


Yours Sincerely


Dr. Bernadette Fallon


Fax:+44  (0) 871 50 31830

Dr. Bernadette Fallon

UK VIRGINS ATLANTIC net-communicationcenter@hotmail.com

Good Day,

I received your email and I advise you make contact with Barrister Mrs X via the email address below ( (scammer name)@hotmail.co.uk) she will guide you on the step to take in regards to the necessary courier charges.

Once again congratulation.

Yours Sincerely

Dr. Bernadette Fallon

Fax:+44 (0) 871 50 31830

(As usual, we shift to potential victim to the "closer" so that the original scammer can go back to work. I keep asking questions and I'm starting to get in the way.)

Lou

messages.body:
(scammer name)@hotmail.co.uk


12/23/11 


DEAR LOU SINDOR,


I AM IN RECEIPT OF YOUR EMAIL AND I NOTED YOUR GREAT CONCERN TO GET  YOUR
PACKAGE DELIVERED TO YOUR ADDRESS .THE COST INVOLVE IS £ 378.00 GREAT
BRITISH POUNDS WHICH IS THE COST OF  FEDEx INTERNATIONAL DELIVERY MODE
WHICH YOU ARE TO SEND VIA Western Union MONEY TRANSFER ALONGSIDE WITH A
SCAN COPY OF THE PAYMENT SLIP FOR THE RECORD OF FEDEx COURIER COMPANY.


PAYMENT INSTRUCTIONS.
RECEIVERS NAME: BARRISTER MRS X
RECEIVERS ADDRESS: 2-5 WARWICK COURT LONDON WC1R 5DJ
COST OF DELIVERY: £ 378.00 GREAT BRITISH POUNDS


I WILL APPRECAITE IF YOU ACT DILIGENTLY TO INSTRUCTION GIVEN TO YOU AND
IMMEDAITELY YOUR PAYMENT IS BE COMFIRMED BY ME, FEDEx WILL DELIVER YOUR
PACKAGE TO YOU WITHIN 2-3 WORKINGS DAYS WITHOUT ANY LAG.


I AWAIT SCAN COPY RECEIPT OF THE Western Union IN YOUR NEXT EMAIL.


YOURS SINCERELY,
BARRISTER MRS X

messages.body:
12/23/11 


(Barrister Mrs X),


It would be much simpler if this package was sent C.O.D. as Western Union
is not a very reliable way to move money. There are many who use it as a
way to scam people, I've heard.


Lou
messages.raw:
Lou Sindor

12/23/11

(Barrister Mrs X),

It would be much simpler if this package was sent C.O.D. as Western Union is not a very reliable way to move money. There are many who use it as a way to scam people, I've heard.

Lou

Scamorama hastens to add that Western Union is perfectly reliable if you know who you're sending the money to, and if that someone isn't a scammer :)

messages.body:
(scammer name)@hotmail.co.uk


12/26/11


Dear  Lou Sindor,


I receive your email and I thank you for the infinite confidence in the
delivery of your winning cheque to you. Sorry the listed courier companies
do not have Cost of delivery on winning cheque due to the fact that it is
the fee of keeping your cheque in their possession and have it checked if
it is certified before you receive it.


All you need to do right now to get your cheque delivered to your door
step. I strongly advise you to go ahead and pay the delivery fee of the
courier company so far as to enable them deliver your cheque to you on
time. The fee is 358 GBP only and a onetime fee you are to come up with
this fee as to process the delivery of your Cheque. 


Thanks for your understanding.


Yours Sincerely,
Mrs Barrister X
messages.raw:
Barrister Mrs X

(scammer name)@hotmail.co.uk

12/26/11

Dear Lou Sindor,

I receive your email and I thank you for the infinite confidence in the delivery of your winning cheque to you. Sorry the listed courier companies do not have Cost of delivery on winning cheque due to the fact that it is the fee of keeping your cheque in their possession and have it checked if it is certified before you receive it.

All you need to do right now to get your cheque delivered to your door step. I strongly advise you to go ahead and pay the delivery fee of the courier company so far as to enable them deliver your cheque to you on time. The fee is 358 GBP only and a onetime fee you are to come up with this fee as to process the delivery of your Cheque.

Thanks for your understanding.

Yours Sincerely,
Mrs Barrister X

("Cost of Delivery"? I guess "Barrister Mrs X" is a little unclear on what C.O.D. is. She also confused her own scam amount; not the sharpest knife in the drawer, I guess.)

messages.body:
12/27/11 


I thought you said it was 378 GBP? Now it's 358 GBP? What's going on here?


Also, you want me to send you money, but I have no proof
of...well...anything. This is all starting to sound a little fishy to me.


Lou
messages.raw:
Lou Sindor

12/27/11

I thought you said it was 378 GBP? Now it's 358 GBP? What's going on here?

Also, you want me to send you money, but I have no proof of...well...anything. This is all starting to sound a little fishy to me.

Lou

messages.body:
Jan 1 


Dear  Lou Sindor,


I receive your email and I wish you and your love ones a fruitful &
rewarding 2012 full of remarkable achievements & joy. Happy New Year.I am
sorry for the mistake as nobody is above little mistake.The initial amount
you are to send is 378 GBP NOT 358.Please accept my mistake.


Please this is a new year and a meaningful chapter is about to unfold,
just be patience and have faith in me.


You should take care of yourself and have a pleasant 2012 with good health.


Yours Sincerely,
(Barrister Mrs X)
Areas of Practice
Career 2005 Called to the Bar
messages.raw:
Barrister Mrs X

Jan 1

Dear Lou Sindor,

I receive your email and I wish you and your love ones a fruitful & rewarding 2012 full of remarkable achievements & joy. Happy New Year.I am sorry for the mistake as nobody is above little mistake.The initial amount you are to send is 378 GBP NOT 358.Please accept my mistake.

Please this is a new year and a meaningful chapter is about to unfold, just be patience and have faith in me.

You should take care of yourself and have a pleasant 2012 with good health.

Yours Sincerely,
(Barrister Mrs X)
Areas of Practice
Career 2005 Called to the Bar

messages.body:
Jan 2


Dear  Luo  Sindor,


Sequel to your email which was noted.Please let me reassure you that,I
don't need your money because every expense incur from your end is for the
progress of delivery of your cheque. Beside I was born into a christian
family even my brother is a pastor herein London so you don't know the
gospel more than I do.


Please pray according with me please....Lord Jesus, help me to remain
faithful to You and your calling upon my life.  Strengthen and grow my
faith as I daily search Your Scriptures and apply their truths to my
spiritual walk.  As I go through the trials and experiences of my earthly
journey would You fix my eyes and my ever-wandering heart upon Jesus. When
the howling winds and forceful storms of this life attempt to shipwreck my
faith may they instead prove my faith to be more than sufficient to
withstand the continual assaults from the enemy.  Because I take refuge in
Jesus my spiritual foundation is firm, always dependable, and leads me to
glorious victory.  Amen.



Thank You, Jesus, that in the midst of loss and devastation, those who
trust in You have a salvation that is steadfast and imperishable.


Have a blessed day ahead.
Your sincerely,
Barrister Mrs X
messages.raw:
Barrister Mrs X

Jan 2

Dear Luo Sindor,

Sequel to your email which was noted.Please let me reassure you that,I don't need your money because every expense incur from your end is for the progress of delivery of your cheque. Beside I was born into a christian family even my brother is a pastor herein London so you don't know the gospel more than I do.

Please pray according with me please....Lord Jesus, help me to remain faithful to You and your calling upon my life. Strengthen and grow my faith as I daily search Your Scriptures and apply their truths to my spiritual walk. As I go through the trials and experiences of my earthly journey would You fix my eyes and my ever-wandering heart upon Jesus. When the howling winds and forceful storms of this life attempt to shipwreck my faith may they instead prove my faith to be more than sufficient to withstand the continual assaults from the enemy. Because I take refuge in Jesus my spiritual foundation is firm, always dependable, and leads me to glorious victory. Amen.

etc. etc.
This kept going for five or six paragraphs and seems to have been copied, in more or less its entirety, from http://www.prayerfortoday.net/.
It ended with this:

Thank You, Jesus, that in the midst of loss and devastation, those who trust in You have a salvation that is steadfast and imperishable.

Have a blessed day ahead.
Your sincerely,
Barrister Mrs X

messages.body:
Jan 3 


Dear  Lou Sindor,


I advise you should have faith,, because all things have a purpose but
sometimes it does not appear  as you think wrongly !!


I will appreciate if you act diligently to instructions given to you.


Yours sincerely,
(Barrister Mrs X)


Areas of Practice
Career 2005 Called to the Bar
http://www.tanfieldchambers.co.uk/Barristers/Mrs X
messages.raw:
Barrister Mrs X

Jan 3

Dear Lou Sindor,

I advise you should have faith,, because all things have a purpose but sometimes it does not appear as you think wrongly !!

I will appreciate if you act diligently to instructions given to you.

Yours sincerely,
(Barrister Mrs X)

Areas of Practice
Career 2005 Called to the Bar
http://www.tanfieldchambers.co.uk/Barristers/Mrs X

(A little desperation has started to creep in as I didn't answer during the holiday. Nice of her to lead us all in a little prayer, though. Very thoughtful.)

Tanfield Chambers is an actual law firm, in London.
They have nothing to do with the scammer, and their web site contains a warning about scams.
Yes, we said it before. If you didn't see this above, well, you're seeing it now.

Lou

Jan 3

(Time for the payoff ... with a little love note added. I've attached it for your entertainment.)

Note the warning posted about using internet cafe facilities for scamming.
For all we know, the people were random customers.
